meanings.definition: Engaging in political activities to gain an advantage over others.
meanings.sent1: During the election season, candidates are constantly outpoliticking each other for votes.
meanings.sent2: The senator was known for outpoliticking his opponents with clever strategies.
meanings.sent3: The mayor's outpoliticking skills were so good, he even convinced the rival party to support his proposal.
meanings.sent4: She outpoliticked her rival by forming alliances behind the scenes.
meanings.sent5: The art of outpoliticking requires both cunning and charisma.

meanings.definition: To outmaneuver or outsmart others in political situations.
meanings.sent1: In the debate, the candidate skillfully outpoliticked his opponents with well-prepared arguments.
meanings.sent2: The diplomat was able to outpolitick his adversaries in the negotiation process.
meanings.sent3: The student council president outpoliticked his classmates by proposing a fun school event.
meanings.sent4: She outpoliticked her rival by anticipating his moves and countering effectively.
meanings.sent5: Outpoliticking requires strategic thinking and quick decision-making.
